verbatim_example: I've been messing around with heroin and bupe since about April - my most recent relapse. It's been just over a week without bupe.
I've been messing around with heroin and bupe since about April - my most recent relapse. I went from daily half teenth IV dope to nothing after a week of using gradually reduced doses of bupe.
Just switched from IV 4 harm redux. After 15 years I'm having to learn a totally new skill!
In less than three weeks I'll be a year clean.

I quit everything about a year and a half ago with the help of a detox place. I relapsed by starting to use Kratom and then ventured into RC benzos as a way to get off Kratom, but of course that spiraled into abusing both and graduating to harder opiates as well as filling my adderall script.

I quit opiates/benzos/adderall 12 days ago, now I am trying to stabilize on Kratom. ... For the past 4-6 weeks I was trying to go about 4-5 days before using again, but wasn't really lowering my doseages.
The last time I took DHC or Xanax was the Sunday of Labor Day... On day 9 I felt some relief, I thought I made it through the worst...
Many know I have been dealing with a tough addiction and recent withdrawal. I was on a large benzo/opiate habit and got off both 3 weeks to the day.
I've been 4 months sober, I was rooting for him, he struggled in the past, but now he's at a homeless shelter and gave it all up.
I've only got 5 months but I'm telling you. I'm so excited to wake up each day doing something I love.
haven't had any opis in months
I am in the thick of wd. I couldn't do it without you guys. I have been to a couple of meeting.
A week ago, I was terrified to give up the pills... The oxy and benzos ruled my every waking moment. ...I still haven't had the withdrawals I was expecting...
I have been suffering from chronic pain the majority of my life... For the past ten yrs, I've still been in pain, but so over medicated that I didn't care. Now that I am clean...
So, ya obvs 26 days clean. Still having restless legs, but my regular Dr says they're not related, which means that the only withdrawal symptom I had was insomnia...
I am happy to be here, sober .
I've never used a needle. Why? Seriously. I just want a "normal" friend.
Every year, Ive celebrated by getting as high as possible. Not this year. I celebrated by not using.
Six months ago I couldn't even go 60 minutes without having to use something.
Six months and some change ago I couldn't even go 60 minutes without having to use something to change the way I feel. This is the only period of sobriety I've had in 10 years.
I used to run one in r/opiates
I was in a hospital bed, could barely walk and breathe, was doing the “undercover ninja” every night to try and get comfortable to sleep, and had no direction or positive things in my life.
a year ago I was in a hospital bed with a Staff Infection and Pneumonia; I was making plans to go pick up the second I got out...
I’m officially one year clean from opiates.
It's day 3 off of a 8 day relapse.
One week down, working on day 8.
Eight days down, moving into day 9.

I'm wrapping up day 11 in a few hours... I still cry like a baby sometimes but less frequently... I still blow up the bathroom in the morning but it doesn't persist all day... I still can't sleep well but I'm grabbing more random spurts of it... I still feel emotionally flatlined but I've caught myself laughing a few times this week and joking with others.

Coming up on two weeks later today. I feel like I can remember every second that's passed by. Good - Don't feel like last week. Getting a lot of exercise. Haven't missed a day of work. Sleep is trying to return slowly. Not as many emotional spells. Appetite is coming back (especially after exercise). Getting a lot of shit taken care of. Saving money.
This past weekend was better than the last... Nothing crazy, I still didn't feel amazing or super peppy but I was able to function and get around to do shit.
Today I feel... decent? It feels like my body is trying to act normal and my brain is just a few steps behind. Sort of feels like I'm a more functional shell of myself... in a good way.
Yesterday went pretty well other than a few cases of the clammy sweats... Still some morning GI stuff. Clams come and go.
Yesterday was okay minus a crazy afternoon episode of the sweats... Lingering symptoms are still morning GI/Restless when I try to relax/anxiety sweats.
Symptoms at 3 weeks out... broken sleep of 4-6 hours, morning shits (a very zen one this morning at least), anhedonia waves, come and go restless limbs.
Sunday morning the fog rolled back in. Emotional, tons of GI issues, anxiety sweats, depressed, stir crazy, irritable, restless. Felt like day 4 of withdrawals out of the blue.
Only things lingering around at 25 days are morning GI, restless sleep, anxiety/anhedonia waves.
This was the day of the month I would get my script refilled and normally start the process of one GREAT week followed by the cycle of withdrawal etc etc.
I've gone this long. I feel so much better than I thought I would.
I've now gone five days without
I have been off heroin for six days now, but last night and this morning i had an incredibly bad toothache. I mean I was literally writing in my bed in pain.
Had my ups and downs. But this time I'm real. Day. 3.
I've gone further than I thought I could, I've been browsing here it really helps. Every. Minute. Every. Hour. Each one is one closer to being better.
I haven't thought that in a long time even when I made it to three days before.
I was so fucked up on dope and xanax and kpins that i blacked out the entire way.
This is the longest I've been sober in a year at least.
It's been a month and a half... It's amazing how much my life has changed for the better.
i haven't gone through any withdrawals in a very long time (been abusing opiates for about 5 years now)
Anyways, at anytime I keep at least 40 pounds of poppyseeds incase the site I order from gets shut down, or something gets lost in the male, by doing this, I haven't WD'd in close to 2 years,
I've tried to quit 5 times in the last year or so. Start a program, leave the program. Get through detox, feel great and then "just for the weekend" myself back into active addiction.
I'm actually looking forward to it, rather than mocking the whole process. The days where I feel out of control and anxious are farther and farther apart.
I've got 4 months clean and sober - the idea of being in pain just riles me up. I know that there is no chance in hell that I can have any opiates without coming unhinged.
I've always been a very prideful person... I kicked a 4 year IV meth habit. ...This opiate habit struck me like a cancer... I was weak and helpless and insecure.

I've dealt with it with ice and NSAIDs, chiropractic care, acupuncture and massage. It got really bad, to where I couldn't even write in my 12-step book without excessive pain so I went to the orthopedist.

The memory fades as time goes by. I doubt the memories will ever disappear completely, but I liken it to the memories of an ex-girlfriend... When you first break up, it is pretty much all you can think about- just like dope. But as time passes, those memories become less often, and also less detailed.

I remember when I was using... And if not that, then it would be some other complete bullshit nonsense excuse that my brain would trick me into believing, thus delaying doing what I knew deep down that I really wanted to do.

Myself as well as the large majority of opiate users I have met along my journey through recovery all have almost the same story. Got injured in some way, got prescribed Vicodin, Percocet, Oxys, even fucking Fentanyl in some cases- and then, after unknowingly becoming physically dependent on the medication (which the doctors often failed to warn about), the doc suddenly ends the script.
I was in recovery, and actually a year or so into it at that point. I’ll never forget it- constant memories of using and wanting to use.
Clean for over two years... (past tense) and the state label is 'withdrawal' does not match, but since it's actually 'recovery', the condition is met.
I've been clean for two years, and my drug of choice is and always will be heroin. I haven't tried to get any dope, or even any painkillers.
The worst thing about a craving is that when I get one, it's not for a fuckin vicodin or two, but a needle and a bundle of downs. Ugh. Clenching my teeth lately.
I've been clean for two years, but have been jonesin hard lately...
But it's been so long, that if I were to try to cop shit on the street I'd probably have a rough time. Looking too damn healthy after two years clean.
I haven't touched an opiate in over two years, haven't shot up in almost three...
So I am about 90-100 days clean. It’s the most clean time I’ve had and I seriously couldn’t be happier.
Young dude, had so much going for him, 3 years clean and used once and now he’s gone.
I’m over 1 year into sobriety... I still am very sensitive to the cold. It’s not horrible by any means, but I literally hate being cold it.
I had been many times to ER faking back pain to get a shot of Diladuid and Valium, but after 4 visits in 6 months I didn’t wanna raise red flags but had to get high...
I've been sober for 13 months this coming Friday... When I got clean, I didn't think my last shot of heroin would be the last one for the rest of my life.
I’m also currently in sober living due to my conditions of release/deferred disposition and will have just over 2 years clean when I can leave here.
7/18/16 was the day I actually got sober. The 17th was the last time I had a shot of heroin.
I am on day 15 without Heroin.
I have been on day 18 heroin free but I fucked up currently messed up.
Today i am 15 days off heroin.
Today i am at day 20 heroin and alcohol free.
Today is 34 days without heroin and alcohol, Day 34 Heroin free
Im day 39 heroin and alcohol free.
Today i am on day 50 heroin and alcohol free.  i have never made it this far before with heroin and alcohol.
So i would have been on day 32 off heroin but i ended up going back been using most of the day.
Im on day two without heroin. I been in the bathroom all day puking and shitting.
I am day 10 off heroin and alcohol been in hospital (was brought in there the other day) for dehydration and withdrawals.
I am on day 15 off heroin.
I have been in hospital nerly 2 weeks due to attempting suicide. I am 23 days off alcohol and 27 off Heroin.
I have been in rehab for the passed 3 months, I am two days out and i am living in a house with other clean and sober ppl. I was released from rehab

After about 2 months of clean time, I started using again. ... It got bad very quickly. ... I used every day for about a month. ... You know in recovery, how they talk about that moment where it clicks? Well I had one of those.
With only 60 days clean myself, I think I'm a little jealous that other opiate addicts are still using mind altering chemicals.
I go to 8 meetings a week, and have 62 days.
"...it's about staying self aware and in the moment which is a huge part of recovery and growing as a person."
My life is filled with so much love instead of the bullshit it was filled with for so long.
I have four months clean today... The longest I used to have was 39 days and the entire time I was white knuckling...
I just wanted to tell you guys that this is my first sober Halloween in 5 years!
A little over six months ago, I remember getting strung out in a public bathroom on the boardwalk in Huntington Beach, California. This was the last time I hope I would ever use heroin.

90 days ago I was sitting in the IOP program at the Betty Ford Center stung out of my mind with twenty dollars in my pocket anxiously waiting for it to be over that day so that my friend and I could go score yet again. On the break I was busted and sent to detox there again for the fourth time.
So today I have 252 days clean (8 months 8 days). 5 of those months I spent in a behavior corrections facility or "TC". I'm also in a drug court probation program.
I'm currently finishing up my fifth day sober-ish (on xanax rn) and through the worst of the physical WDs.

I was heavily addicted to heroin last year but have been clean since June 14. I took some tramadol on friday, more on Saturday, skipped Sunday, used Monday, skipped yesterday, and yesterday I was feeling extremely depressed, sweating, cold, jittery/RLS, classic mild WDs.
I’ve been clean off of all drugs for 39 days.
I’ve been clean off of all drugs for 39 days.
It's been nearly two years since I stopped injecting oxy, oxymorphone, hydromorphone, morphine, and anything else really.
As of October 12th I was officially two years sober
This is what I did before I sold my studio for opiates 3 years ago.
I've been running and addiction and support group for almost a year now. I use kratom to treat members of the group with better success than I've seen in most other programs.
So last weekend my original dude calls me. I was like fuck yeah and we went through the whole long process of back and forth trying to figure out when to meet.

Tomorrow marks 1 week since my last 2lb dose of PST. Symptoms have been managed with Lope for the first 2 days, and then nothing stronger than an ill advised couple Benadryl on day 3, and a few advil.
One of the times I cleaned up in the past, of an oxycontin habit of 80-120 mg a day, I went in to a bit of a manic episode.
I'm currently 15 days clean off PST and used Lope taper to quit.
So I've got about 3 weeks clean off a 2 year PST habit of about 2 lbs a day.
5 weeks off a pretty heavy PST habit
12 year off and on opiate user with ~3 years as longest clean time, coming of my longest everyday using time of 2+ years (starting 300g poppy seeds/day, going to 2.5lbs seeds/day)
I've got about 6 months clean from an on/off whenever I could get it(percs>oxys>heroin>oxys>poppy seeds>heroin>oxy you get it) habit over last 12 years.
I'm also ice cold, is that a withdrawal thing? ... It's almost day seven. I am sober.
End of day seven, goddamn bastard 14-hour workday is done. Bye-bye Egghead U, I'm going the hell home to a bath (my back!) and some sleep.
When I kicked opiates I also kicked caffeine, and I haven't had a drink in a long time. And I promise myself that after the hell of withdrawal I will never go down that road again.
Still free and clear... My body is like an old, tired sock... I keep wanting to stretch out, shake and use my muscles a bit. I'm so weak, it's been years.
I have been clean for two weeks now. No opiates. No drinking. No caffeine.
Three weeks ago I was in hell. My body went through an absolute horror show of pain. Fever, shakes, nausea, muscle cramps... insomnia, jesus.
Four weeks. I am clean, I am alive, I am beginning to feel comfortable in my skin.
Six weeks was miles in the future, never thought I'd get here. Here I am. ... Six weeks clean, feels like kind of a big deal!

I have been out with family and friends, walked in nature, went to a concert, held hands with my love, played with my kid, did my taxes, did some exercises. I remember how shit it was most of the time, how sick I got, how needy I became.
I have been clean for ten weeks and three days -- I genuinely lost track.
I'm fine. Every day is just a day now. I don't wake up in agony, thinking about a fix constantly. I just... live.

The video title suggests that the speaker has already gone through the process of addiction and is now in a state of recovery, as indicated by the phrase 'Everything We Think We Know About Addiction Is Wrong'. This implies that the speaker has withdrawn from opioids in the past and is now focused on sustaining abstinence.
I have two years sober today... I used to tell myself that I have done the damage to my brain and I can never truly be happy. I will say that all that shit is wrong.
We never used together but we were both hopeless dope fiends at the same time but never talked.

I was addicted to heroin again after my first stint in rehab got me almost 6 months of sobriety.

I think the most important thing is honesty but a close second for me was habit/process. I had a habit of getting high every day and it was my routine... it took a process to create a new one.

I am 8 months sober from a heavy heroin habit. My family still see me as the piece of shit I use to be but I can honestly say that I have done a completely 180 and would not even dream of the things I may have done before.
So, I have been clean for 12 days other than 4 days ago I got a bag. I just don't have the money for it right now.
I haven't used since the day but the cravings have been there 24/7.
I haven't touched an opiate in almost 5 months.
I haven't been around here for a while because the temptation was too much but lately I've found myself lurking more and more and fantasizing more and more.
Since going cold turkey a bit more than a week ago I’ve hardly had any cravings for the stuff.
My friend od’d on methadone last summer, just got arrested for possession half a year after the fact because I was too busy giving cpr to hide my bottle.
I kicked my h habit about 3 weeks ago and haven’t had the urge to use more than every now and then since

Pretty insecure about it cause I only really make joke music. Being serious scares the christ outta me... Anyways lmk what you think, any constructive criticism is accepted with open arms. Pretty new to this music thing.
it's about my mindset when I was using
I have been at the house for the 5th day now. But another day sober.
I remember myself before using and I was fun, outgoing, worked my ass off and people enjoyed being around me. Now I have messed with drugs my entire adult life, more recreationally.

Still NO SLEEP!!!! (past tense of experiencing sleep deprivation due to withdrawal), Still (present tense but in the context of past experience) a better day, Stay clean everybody (encouragement for others in recovery)
I can tell the difference. But it does feel good to not have opiates pumping through me.
Feeling sooo much better. Sleep is still shit. But hit a meeting last night, great topics. Feeling good today, hopeful. Conversations are easier, crawling my ass out of bed is easier.
and her knowing it was sincere and that I am sober
Stay clean. Shit tends to work out in the end.

Two years went by and I was making close to 1500$ a week living at home with my parents, paying close to no bills.....with a bank account running on E. Oxycontin was no longer my friend, but my lifeblood. I needed it more than food in the morning.

Tried to cold turkey approx 8mg sub last year went a month clean and I just couldn't bear it anymore.
Two weeks ago I gave a short 7 sub taper a try.
Now I am one of those people, and you the reader with a bit of grit and hard work will be too.
it's been about 4 months off opiates and I have done it without any real support system besides my girlfriend and family.
I never get withdrawals; I used to but got past the worst of my addiction and now I only use two times a week give or take a day.
I figured it was time to stop. Lope definitely helped my withdrawals the first three days and then when I woke up on the 4th day, I felt completely fine.

Starting all over now. Day 3. My withdrawals are never really that bad besides the sleep problem but I just take two extremely high doses of loperamide each 48 hours apart and before I know it i'm clear of the withdrawals
I just got out of my 2nd stint in rehab today and my mother is sooo supportive.
I have meditated on and off, usually when I had a steady supply of heroin. Was doing a bundle a day but now im 24 days clean...

So I have been clean now from heroin, well from everything including cigarettes for 40 days. Things continually pop up and cause my mom trouble in her marriage like me having stolen her credit card back when I was using (she just found out).
I would not have been outside and saw that duck if the cosmos did not align in such a way for me to stay sober now for 6 weeks and 3 days.

I remember endless aching Timeless nights spent sleepless, taking anything to stop the shaking, Anything i'd found Thinking nothing, feeling hollow planning all the highs to follow all the pain and pills to swallow stolen; hidden; downed I remember darkness creeping up and out and sinking, seeping crying in the night and sleeping lost without a sound
I was thinking yesterday listening to this podcast about a life story from a former addict who actually turned their life around and now has a masters degree, a family, etc, and is doing great.
damn, was a dark individual during those times. hahaha, I can't even believe I wrote that considering the change within my self over this past year.

I went back out, woke up with my whole family crying over the hospital bed. What the fuck was wrong with me. Why was I so selfish and not considerate of the people that raised me and gave me everything.
This withdrawal thing didn’t work so good in the past, but I really think this time is the one I’m gonna be able to come out on the other side.
I survived day 1 (today) easy, I have no idea why I tried to do it myself 50 times when I should have come here right away.
I still have running lava from my ass and only sleep five hours a night
Five days ago I did two shots of heroin before I fell asleep. Did not enjoy the high for more that 20 min, could not stat awake, not worth it.

I had to start the wd all over but it is like 1/3 painfull so I am actually enjoying myself. I mean it is still shitty but not to the point where I can’t function, and that makes me able to do some normal erryday stuff.
Being clean is hard but if I keep it up mabye some day I won’t have to keep fighting the urge to use or to kill myself.
Plan on taking 16mgs. I am an IV user and was probably shooting up half a gram to gram of heroin a day or 3 to 8 diluadeds a day.
last September I went to rehab, ended up staying clean for 8 months, and relapsed in June and been using for two months
last September I went to rehab, ended up staying clean for 8 months, and relapsed in June and been using for two months
On day 7!!!!!, in the next 12 hours or so I will oficially have a week clean. The only WD symtoms I am still having is the sleep...

I am on day 7 of quitting cold turkey. This is not my first rodeo with recovery though, but my first time getting clean without rehab... I always end up relapsing around the 9 month mark, happened twice already.
Just hit day 8 of quitting so I have been officially clean for a week now.
I'm finally over the physical withdraws, which is great.
I'm close to the end of day 12 of being sober and I am extremely stressed about going to work. I'm shaking as I'm writing this.
I just came off a 5 month run a month ago. Made it through withdraws and had 15 days completely sober.

I did a three day sub taper which helped out but seemed to prolong the WD process. And working through this and trying to function as a normal human being has been the hardest thing I ever done especially when my sub taper was over.
I’m closing in on about two weeks clean and I still can’t sleep to save my life. It’s starting to become a quality of life issue at this point.
I’m closing in on about two weeks clean and I still can’t sleep to save my life.
I’ve been clean for 2 weeks and relapsed last night by snorting two stamp bags of heroin (ecp). I’ve been done the physical withdraws for like a week now
I managed to get clean for a few weeks. Caved and started chipping every 72 hours and now I’ve been using everyday again for the past couple weeks.
My dealer always told me if I ever wanted to quit he would completely cut me off and I finally gave him the word and he completely cut me off lol. Im 24 hours in right now and feel quite terrible.
Once you got clean, how long did it take to feel like your was brain was pumping out them juices again?
I’ve never been able to break out of my shell my entire life. I’m clean now with 25 days sober
I’m newly clean (got 10 days completely sober), and need help with my car (one of my main using spots).
Been clean for about 45 days and my guy just hit me up for the first time.
yesterday I went to a methadone clinic and got prescribed 15 mg and I took it, today I woke up around the same time and woke up sweaty with chills and hot flashes

we are trying to figure out what we need to look into over the weekend, despite losing it all I am glad I can say we don't have to worry about where money will come and trying to get through each day without having to WD
Until one day I just had to leave because I was dope sick
I was clean for a while but a series of unfortunate events lead me back to a needle in my arm.
Luckily I've only been using everyday for about 3 weeks, but fuck. I'm 24 hours into withdraw and it's tough.
I started a real program today. It's my first day sober, again.
I went last night to my first NA meeting in years and it was awesome! Met some great people and ran into an old friend. I really liked the format, and it was at midnight which was really helpful.
It's day 5 for me, got to sleep in today which was nice, slept for about 9 hours. Shared for the first time at NA last night.
Today is day 13 for me! This is the longest I've been sober since summer 2011, and first time I'm really sober.
Earlier this summer if you told me that at midnight every Friday and Saturday night I'd be at an NA meeting, I would have laughed in your face.
But, I am clean, and life is good! ... We all can, and will, get our lives back in time.

I'm feeling good today, had a minor drug dream last night so I got up a bit earlier than usual this morning but I didn't let it bring me down like I usually would! Trying to move forward, and have another day sober under my belt.

I've hemmed and hauled about weather or not to go, but after getting advice from my IOP group, NA home group, and therapists; I have decided to go. ... This will be the first trip I have every taken sober...
It's day 59 for me. Yesterday I had a big surprise; I graduated from IOP! ... So now I have my certificate, and I, feeling pretty good!
Weather you have years, months, days, or hours clean

Been trying to pick up on hobbies like sneakers, movies, working on my car, etc. Shits been going pretty well. I have good days and bad days. Been in a bit of a funk since right around my 90 days clean.
It's day 110 for me since I last used opiates, marijuana, alcohol, coca in, etc. ... It snowed today for the first time that I've ever been sober.
A year ago this week was a whirlwind and this week will be too, but for totally different reasons. I just finished up my duties as GSR to my homegroup last night for the week...
I haven't done opiates in 10 months and I still fantasize about doing dope constantly.  And dream about scoring, or remembering a misplaced gram in my room every night.

And I looked old as a teenager and was the guy most likely to get away with buying cigs in high school, but I seemed to stop aging or go in reverse when I started using.
Now after quitting H for almost 2 years it's like I've aged 10 years.
I had my last oxy yesterday morning -- then I had about 1mg of sub last night, and I'm 100% dry

As of Thursday, I was using 60mg of oxy to get right daily and 30mg to not be sick. Come at me, chills; come at me stomach problems. I'm so tired of constantly dealing with moderate to severe withdrawals.
I broke up with the crazy girl, got a Percocet script because my leg's fucked up; I overdosed on a psychedelic and was hospalitized;
After 90 hours since my last oxycodone dose, I can officially say that I am withdrawal free (with minor exception).
I've had to call on my clean friends and therapist every single day for the past week. Hanging on for dear life here.
Smoked a roach I had in my ash tray on Friday night and felt immense relief from the nasty cravings I was/am getting for my DOC.
Went back for that one last time. Slept the first 12 hours. Unable to keep any food or even water down.
I just hit 96 hours into my current detox. Feeling a little more human.
I'm barely 100 hours into my detox but I'm just thinking about last Wednesday around noon, three hours after my last dose,
I had been clean since February 22nd but was at a point where I knew if I didn't do something drastic that it would only be a matter of time before I picked up again, like so many other times.

I'm an addict in early recovery (Feb. 22), I've been thankful to have some extra time before the event to continue to work on my shit but I'm also terrified that the life upheaval will be more than I WANT to handle.

Hello, I love browsing this sub even though I have been clean off heroin for 7 years and some change. ... After trying NA and all that and never making 60 days of being clean, I was in the suboxin program multiple times. I had finally made it, I thought, had a job, a car, was selling OxyContin in 09 and taking subs, had money,women, dope was never sick and after spending 5 hours trying to find a vein one day I just had enough and stopped.
I have been homeless have boosted and done various other things for a daily fix. Detox 7 times, impatient numerous times...etc etc.
I'm 24 and haven't touch heroin/opiates in a year.
I'm withdrawing and will be up aaall night. Would KILL for some benzos or something, but it is what it is.

I used to be quite active on this sub but got clean for close to a year. Well I relapsed and it turned into a three month bender...I was previously an active user for 8 years with 6 months clean once or twice until this last 90 day slip.
Headed into day 4 now of withdrawal from bth. Far from my first rodeo but I'm at the breaking point.
Haven't slept still at all, just absolutely miserable and losing my mind. ...this morning was the worst so far.

I was basically sitting on my hands watching the clock minute by minute telling myself not to leave the house. I knew if I left I'd get dope. I was just so miserable, so depressed, complete anhedonia, couldn't even watch a fucking TV show. Nothing could hold my attention and I felt crushing sadness and hopelessness.
used to share my opiate inspired artwork here now and then, just celebrated 18 months clean
I have a little over 18 months clean... I used to spend every day wishing I was dead when I was using, who knew I'd get clean and feel the same.

I have been opiate free for a respectable amount of time and I wasn't ever a huge gamer, but twice a week I would be able to sit in front of an Xbox or computer for a couple hours and indulge in fantasy world.
He was great. The thing is, I coached him through his kick while I was still in the depths.
When we don't eat healthily our entire bodies pretty much shut down and we both become very tired, irritable, and lack motivation.
So here I am, 60 days clean today. I am very active and busy in my recovery.
Just out of curiosity. I feel like getting to a meeting and expanding my support group a little.

These 6 months of recovery have been fucking amazing!! I started at the very bottom at a sales job, and have worked my way close to the top. Just got promoted to sales manager last week! I'm making great money, and will be in the market for my own little condo by summer.
I've been in and out of recovery since '09 and this is the longest I've managed to stay clean.
I've been sticking it out, and great things are happening in my life right now. I'll be getting my license back this week, and hopefully getting a car in a month or so.
coming off a 3 week heroin binge, coming off of oxycodone... expecting to be ready to die in about eight hours
then i learned it was sunday. saw a bunch of my old foils, burned all the residue off, enough for 2-3 good rips, didnt smoke ANY.
my W/D's finished and i'm alive!
havent used one of these in about a year.

I got one to help cope with withdrawal and chip off Heroin, because for some reason I don't feel a craving for Oxy like I do with Heroin and as long as I do a tiny bit of opiate I can usually endure any remaining w/d symptoms.
Is the dope boy the first guy you call? Time to call the dope boy.
I was taking 8mg clonazepam for 2 full years daily (RX'd) and probably 80-100mg oxycodone a day and cut both cold turkey once.

I haven't had a dream about using in almost a month, I have a sweet new job lined up with benefits and a good, healthy living wage, and I'm on track from tapering down from 16mg to 2mg of suboxone daily. My doctor even says that I was stabilized far too high at detox (which is rare from what I hear) and I'm on a taper plan where I drop 2mg per week down to 8 (currently on 10, dropping to 8 tomorrow), and 2mg every 2 weeks after that until I'm down to 2, which I'll probably stay on for a while just as a safety net as I finish getting my life together.

I have been off opiates for 3 years now thanks to kratom & a shit-load of willpower.
I decided to quit about a month ago and for the first time, I felt like I was mentally done with the shit.

I remember googling things like, "Will I ever be happy again after opiates?" because I was convinced that the dark days were my new constant state. Looking back just a few short weeks, I don't even recognize that sad person that I was.
Over the past month, I couldn't take a damn nap to save my life.
I have 135 days today... I quit cold turkey and I don't go to NA/AA... I haven't relapsed so far.

72 days in an in-patient facility. I feel like a new person altogether. Its hard to view the pictures here and read the posts without feeling uneasy and anxious now. Funny how that shit changes. This is the last time I will go through this.
